results.title: Mary and Max
results.brief_description: A tale of friendship between two unlikely pen pals: Mary, a lonely, eight-year-old girl living in the suburbs of Melbourne, and Max, a forty-four-year old, severely obese man living in New York, for which Adam Elliot won an Academy Award.

constellations_other.name: Culture and identity on the Australian screen
constellations_other.description: Australian screen culture is distinctive, unexpected, playful and serious when it matters. Indigenous productions make a huge contribution to the unique identity of the Australian moving image.

constellations_other.name: Storytime animated
constellations_other.description: Abra Cadabra was the world's first stereoscopic 3D film, but animators and filmmakers had experimented with the technology far earlier and continue to use other older techniques like stop-motion animation.

results.description: A tale of friendship between two unlikely pen pals: Mary, a lonely, eight-year-old girl living in the suburbs of Melbourne, and Max, a forty-four-year old, severely obese man living in New York. In the mid-1970’s, a homely, friendless Australian girl of 8 picks a name out of a Manhattan phone book and writes to him; she includes a chocolate bar. He writes back, with chocolate. Thus begins a 20-year correspondence. Will the two ever meet face to face?
description_for_label: A tale of friendship between two unlikely pen pals: Mary, a lonely, eight-year-old girl living in the suburbs of Melbourne, and Max, a forty-four-year old, severely obese man living in New York. In the mid-1970’s, a homely, friendless Australian girl of 8 picks a name out of a Manhattan phone book and writes to him; she includes a chocolate bar. He writes back, with chocolate. Thus begins a 20-year correspondence. Will the two ever meet face to face?

results.title: Mary
results.creator_credit: Kay Pavlou, Rosemary Blight and R B Films
results.brief_description: Lucy Bell stars as Mary MacKillop in this dramatisation of her life. Born to Scottish migrant parents, Mary experienced a calling to the religious life when she was five. As a young woman she was troubled by the poverty and injustice of colonial Australia and established the Sisters of St. Joseph. Her work brought her into conflict with the Catholic hierachy and she was at one point excommunicated. Her faith and dedication never wavered and her Order continues to inspire to this day. Lucy Bell gives an excellent performance as Mary, providing an insight into the character of this amazing woman.

results.title: Mary
results.brief_description: ‘Mary’ combines colour film from the early 1950s as well as modern 16mm footage. Scratched and painted upon, this experimental film links timeless images of the ocean with old footage of a young woman. The effect is both mysterious and moody creating an intangible, lingering feeling of melancholy.

results.title: Marxism: the theory that split a world
results.creator_credit: George Kaczender, John Kemeny, Learning Group of America and International Cinemedia Centre
results.brief_description: A combination of animation, archival material, documentary and fictional recreation is used to portray the history of Karl Marx, and to give the audience an understanding of the influences to his theory of communism.

results.title: Marx for beginners (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Bob Godfrey, Cucumber Studios and Contemporary Films
results.brief_description: Bob Godfrey and his collaborators, Clive Morton and Kevin Attew, have created a distillation of the works of Marx. Its intention is to make Marx more accessible and attractive to a wide range of people through its humorous graphic style.

results.title: Marvin's room
results.creator_credit: Jerry Zaks, Robert De Niro, Jane Rosenthal, Scott Rudin, Tribeca Productions and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: Bessie is a strong, sensitive and selfless middle-aged woman who has sacrificed her life to look after her ailing and bed-ridden father and slightly daft aunt. Her younger sister, Lee, shirked off such responsibilities, left home, married and had two children before divorcing. The marked differences between the two have meant that neither sister has been in contact for 20 years. But now Bessie has been diagnosed with leukemia, and her survival may depend on the sister she has long since erased from her life, or her two nephews whom she has never met. Cast includes: Diane Keaton, Meryl Streep, Robert De Niro, and Leonardo Di Caprio.

results.title: Marvel, a Jakarta Boy
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, John Morris and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian neighbours. Indonesia”.
A day in the life of a 14 year old boy. Marvel comes from a migrant Minangkabau family, seeking a new way of life in the busy city of Jakarta. He sells rice cakes to the taxi drivers outside the tourist hotels. His father is a middle man in a small “Pasar”.

results.title: Marvel's The Punisher
results.brief_description: A former Marine out to punish the criminals responsible for his family’s murder finds himself ensnared in a military conspiracy.

constellations_other.name: Powerful women in the frame and behind the scenes
constellations_other.description: Lady Sarah (Rachel Weisz) exudes power in The Favourite. These female filmmakers and actors do too.

results.title: Marvel's Jessica Jones
results.brief_description: After a tragic ending to her short-lived super hero stint, Jessica Jones is rebuilding her personal life and career as a detective who gets pulled into cases involving people with extraordinary abilities in New York City.

constellations_other.name: Evil AI, dystopias and production design
constellations_other.description: In No Code’s sci-fi thriller players take command of a multi-national space station’s artificial intelligence system to help the sole survivor solve the mystery of a missing crew and why the station is wildly off course.

results.title: Marva
results.creator_credit: Suzanne St Pierre and CBS News
results.brief_description: Marva Collins is a teacher who set up a school in a low income area of Chicago. There are no frills, and students are drilled in vocabulary and multiplication tables, and are required to read one book every two weeks. Many of her students love reading, and Marva is an inspiration to them.
